name: Andrea Heming
text: Excellent cottage with fabulous rustic decor. The owners obviously thought of every little detail. The beds were so soft and luxurious, the kitchen was stocked with more than just the basics, and the back porch was heavenly. This was a superior option to staying in a hotel, and we are already planning on a return trip in the future.

name: Lyn Merrell
text: Great place to stay. Very peaceful.

name: Maxwell
text: A lovely, quiet place in the woods. Perfect for a weekend getaway.

name: Lida Havard
text: Hadn't been

name: Barber UAV
text: Very clean, everything was perfect. It’s a beautiful place and very peaceful. I definitely recommend it!

resp.text: Thank you for your nice comments!  We enjoyed having you here and Loved your veggies!! Please come back!

name: Allison Pullen
text: What a beautiful, peaceful, and FUN location!  Being close to Auburn is convenient, but what’s important is that clearly a lot of heart and a lot of money went into the construction of this place! I love the small details like the muffin basket in the morning, and the high quality of everything throughout the farm is fabulous. Louise and her staff are the best!! They take care of your every need and keep you laughing too!  I can’t wait to return and stay in the big house!!

name: Becky Isaac
text: This is a lovely Lake house on Smith Lake for a large crowd. The house is split in 3 levels with two levels leading outside so that you can have breakfast on the deck overlooking the lake or chill in the hot tub or swing on the lower level. One key thing is though there are no double beds only twin in every room. So if  you have couples be prepared for that. The house was very clean and beds are comfortable. House is well stocked with extras in case you have forgotten something ie toothpaste or shampoo and conditioner. There are also some complimentary drinks and snacks which was a lovely touch. Really enjoyed our family reunion here.

name: Lenette Parris
text: Nice, large home amply stocked with commonly needed items while away from home. Such as snacks and beverages in nice variety.  Kitchen has all you need to prepare meals, though the serving trays were hard to locate ( dining facing island cabinets). There were zip lock bags, coffee. & a plethora of creamer options. There was even a small igloo that worked beautifully to serve ice from during a gathering we hosted while there.  There were decks both off the main level and lower that provided only a  glimpse of the lake but lovely and green woods lined the hill below. The climb down was easy enough, but as it is a very steep lot the return climb back to the house isn't for the physically impaired or injured for certain. Keep this in mind if your group/ family consist of children or those 50+. Table/ work, craft or meeting space took between 30-50% of the space of both the 1st and 3rd floors. Which is great for task or say Bible studies or retreats, but not so much for hanging out during a family reunion or say birthday bash. We needed to use a stash of folding chairs we brought from home, as the inside dining chairs were of a sturdy heavier make, when congregating on the porches. Beds were all twins, mine was worn in moderately,  as I preferred the firmness of the 4 inches on the edge lol. The only draw back I noticed was there was only 1 traditional bath per floor , but a 6 bedroom,  3bath is doable, just something to keep in mind if you are filling all 5 public bedrooms with 14 folks. The hot top functioned well, though the chemical smell that went airborne once the jets were turned on,  set 2 of the 4 of us coughing ( may have had too  much of something in it as it created lots of bubbles/ suds while in use. The most and really only inconvenient thing was having to roll the large trash can up and across the drive and inlet rd to the  dumpster,  if you had a pick up truck or ,like we did with our last bag,  could tie the trash to your door handle and drive up it is easier.

name: Gary Hill
text: Perfect getaway for great quilting

name: Monica Montgomery
text: When Sheriff Johnson was in office, we used to have our yearly Christmas party there. It was always beautiful done. I highly recommend this place for events.

name: Scott Crouch
text: Friendly staff,  beautiful place!! Very cozy!

name: TT
text: Loved it

name: Rosie Findley
text: I love living at the Royal Oaks apartments, Mr Foster is a wonderful person I think a lot of him he's my landlord and just a great guy , love you Foster, Miss Marie Findley.

name: Valerie Spencer
text: Spent a pleasant evening with interesting  conversation great atmosphere and a fabulous breakfast !

name: Jeremy Mockmore
text: Foster (the owner) is an absolutely amazing person I have felt like family from day one! My needs are always met he cooks delicious meals and he keeps a very clean and inviting atmosphere this is THE place to stay in Atmore it feels like home. Right next door to the casino and a hidden gem that I’ll always be happy to stay at!

name: James Bailey
text: We needed a place to stay close to the Wind Creek Casino as we had tickets to see the Gary Allen concert. My wife found MR Foster's place at the Royal Oaks Bed and Breakfast, and I am glad she did. Country atmosphere, polite, friendly and discrete place real close to the Casino. A great big thank you for letting us stay at your little piece of happiness.

name: Kelly Scruggs
text: Beautiful home, Foster was  ery nice and welcoming.  The kids loved all the animals outside!

name: Jonathan Sigmon
text: Wounderful place quit and relaxing

name: Rebecca Childers
text: Simply Perfect......

name: angela harris
text: My daughter's &I enjoyed our stay here. I loved walking the gardens. We lived feeding the turtles and riding the golf cart to the pier to watch the sunset. We ate dinner at Locals which I highly recommend. All of thre artful details and amenities were great!

name: Todd Chancey
text: Excellent. All the amenities of home just provide food and sleep. The owners provide everything else.

name: Michael Conners
text: Great place to stay.

name: Raja V
text: Nice one

name: Humberto Hernández
text:
(Translated by Google) Excellent place

(Original)
Excelente lugar

name: David Krivit
text: The most gracious hosts, providing a comfortable home, terrific grounds & front porch, local history, and access to Monroeville. The correct decision; treat yourself.

name: Rabbitt Staib
text: First time, good time. The entire team here at Cameron was very accommodating the food was great the hunts were excellent. Plenty of quail, and everyone in my group was quite satisfied. Nice meeting area in the back with a fire pit. I really can't say enough about this place. Jonathan taught me quite a lot, and everybody was very safety-minded. I really can't wait to come back here again. I highly recommend this place.

name: Clayton Hudson
text: Fantastic hunting

name: Randy Richesin
text: Had a wonderful hunt everyone so nice; food was amazing ;

name: Charles Hollingshead
text: Great hunting,great staff,and great fun for the family young and old

name: Bill Blair
text: This place is first class in every way. I'm almost 73 years old, and I've been bird hunting since I was too young to carry a gun. I'd follow my daddy, and I'd usually find a good stick to carry, and for a 7 year old, that and my imagination was all I needed. At Cameron's, there are so many very large coveys of quail, it is nearly impossible to estimate how many birds we found. The pointing dogs were very good, and the Boykin spaniels were an absolute pleasure to have there to work for us.  Oh, and we can't forget the meals we had prepared for us. Breakfast and lunch were absolutely delicious. The best quail and gravy I have ever eaten. Great family owned and operated business. They made me feel like I was family. I told our guide that that day of hunting was the most fun that I had ever had with my clothes on!

name: Isaac Russell
text: Good place

name: Chad Kozlowski
text: Thanks again to Cameron Quail Farms for another great hunt this year. My (83 year old) Grandfather and I have visited back to back years and have enjoyed a great hunting experienced in a Family environment. The Cameron family and their staff are amazing people and will treat you like one of their own. Five star hunting, lodging, food, experience and more.

name: Leighton Boggs
text: Great good time!  Killed alot of birds, ate some amazing food and made some good memories. We are sitting by the fire telling stories now. 35 degrees

name: Kevin Brane
text: Char 32 is great for food and now open for lunch.

name: Margaret Bemis Sharp
text: The facility is nice, but the parking wasn't great. I think the event I attended was too large for the venue.

name: Chuck Turner
text: Great food

name: KELDRICK JONES
text: Nice and fun
